clues: This city is home to a famous tower that sparkles every night.
Known as the 'City of Love' and a hub for fashion and art.
fun_fact: The Eiffel Tower was supposed to be dismantled after 20 years but was saved because it was useful for radio transmissions!
Paris has only one stop sign in the entire city—most intersections rely on priority-to-the-right rules.
trivia: This city is famous for its croissants and macarons. Bon appétit!
Paris was originally a Roman city called Lutetia.

clues: This city has the busiest pedestrian crossing in the world.
You can visit an entire district dedicated to anime, manga, and gaming.
fun_fact: Tokyo was originally a small fishing village called Edo before becoming the bustling capital it is today!
More than 14 million people live in Tokyo, making it one of the most populous cities in the world.
trivia: The city has over 160,000 restaurants, more than any other city in the world.
Tokyo’s subway system is so efficient that train delays of just a few minutes come with formal apologies.

clues: Home to a green statue gifted by France in the 1800s.
Nicknamed 'The Big Apple' and known for its Broadway theaters.
fun_fact: The Statue of Liberty was originally a copper color before oxidizing to its iconic green patina.
Times Square was once called Longacre Square before being renamed in 1904.
trivia: New York City has 468 subway stations, making it one of the most complex transit systems in the world.
The Empire State Building has its own zip code: 10118.

clues: This city is known as the 'Eternal City' and is home to ancient ruins.
It is the birthplace of the Roman Empire and has a country within its city limits.
fun_fact: Rome has been continuously inhabited for over 2,500 years.
The Vatican City, the smallest independent nation in the world, is located within Rome.
trivia: Rome has more than 900 churches.
The Colosseum, one of the world's most famous amphitheaters, was used for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.

clues: This city is famous for its iconic opera house with a sail-like roof.
It is the largest city in Australia and known for its beautiful beaches.
fun_fact: The Sydney Opera House took 14 years to build and is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
The city's Bondi to Coogee coastal walk is a popular scenic route.
trivia: Sydney Harbor Bridge is one of the world's largest steel arch bridges.
The city hosts the annual Sydney Mardi Gras, one of the largest LGBTQ+ events in the world.

clues: This city is home to the Great Pyramids and the Sphinx.
It is the largest city in the Arab world and a gateway to ancient Egyptian history.
fun_fact: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the oldest and only remaining wonder of the ancient world.
Cairo has been a center of Islamic learning since the 10th century.
trivia: The Egyptian Museum in Cairo houses the largest collection of ancient Egyptian artifacts in the world.
Cairo's Tahrir Square is a major public square and the focal point of many political events.

clues: This city is the financial and entertainment capital of India.
It is home to Bollywood, the largest film industry in the world.
fun_fact: Mumbai was originally a collection of seven islands that were later merged.
The city has the highest number of billionaires in India.
trivia: The Gateway of India is a famous monument built during the British Raj.
Mumbai's Dharavi slum is one of the largest slums in the world.

clues: This city is known for its onion-domed architecture and the Kremlin.
It is the largest city in Europe and a major political center.
fun_fact: The Kremlin is a fortified complex that includes the official residence of the President of Russia.
Moscow has the deepest metro system in the world, with some stations over 200 feet deep.
trivia: The city's Red Square is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Moscow is home to the Bolshoi Theatre, one of the most famous ballet companies in the world.

clues: This city is the capital of China and known for its rich history.
It is home to the Forbidden City and the Summer Palace.
fun_fact: The Forbidden City was the imperial palace for 24 emperors over nearly 500 years.
Beijing has the largest city park in the world, the Temple of Heaven Park.
trivia: The city has a complex system of hutongs, narrow alleyways that are remnants of old Beijing.
Beijing is the only city to have hosted both the Summer and Winter Olympic Games.

clues: This city straddles two continents, Europe and Asia.
It is known for its rich history and architectural landmarks.
fun_fact: Istanbul was the capital of three great empires: the Roman, Byzantine, and Ottoman Empires.
The city has over 3,000 mosques.
trivia: The Hagia Sophia is a former church, mosque, and now a museum that showcases both Christian and Islamic art.
Istanbul's Grand Bazaar is one of the oldest and largest covered markets in the world.
